0:
--------------------
<Text: Meurimueng-rimueng-do is a two-player abstract strategy board game from Sumatra, Indonesia.>
Triplets:<Meurimueng-rimueng-do
2:
--------------------
Text: Meurimueng-rimueng-do:  The game was published in the book entitled "The Achehnese" by Hurgronje, O'Sullivan, and Wilkinson in 1906 and described on page 204.
Triplets:<Meurimueng-rimueng-do
3:
--------------------
Text: Meurimueng-rimueng-do:  The game is a hunt game similar to Pulijudam and Demala diviyan keliya.
Triplets:<Meurimueng-rimueng-do
4:
--------------------
Text: Meurimueng-rimueng-do:  They use the same triangular board.
Triplets:<Meurimueng-rimueng-do
5:
--------------------
Text: Meurimueng-rimueng-do:  Therefore, meurimueng-rimueng-do is specifically a leopard hunt game (or leopard game).
Triplets:<meurimueng-rimueng-do
7:
Text: Meurimueng-rimueng-do:  The sheep attempt to surround and trap the 5 tigers while the tigers attempt to avoid this fate by capturing enough of the sheep.

Triplets:
<Meurimueng-rimueng-do
